div.p: A prototypical testing framework is provided at:

The testing framework does not support formal conformance; it is not authoritative; and it is not comprehensive. Rather it is a basis to understand the reference actors and transactions and how users may test their own profiled DDCC-based frameworks. The tooling endeavors to provide reuseable artifacts, bulk fake data creation, test fixtures based on common tools, a sandbox for testing, and the ability to run all tests locally on Windows, macOS, and Linux. The tooling uses a prototypical bulk data generator based on templates for FHIR Shorthand and a neutral naming system in the six official UN languages.
